UNIVERSITY BROADCASTING SERVICES
January 23, 1958
Dr. Sam Becker, Chairman
NAEB Research Committee
Television Center
State University of Iowa
Iowa City, Iowa
Dear Sam:
In answer to your question about the conciliation of theses on radio¬
television, you will find the first part of it published in the last issue of
Journal of Broadcasting. &en Harwood informs me that the rest of it will
be done in the next issue.
Both of us are rather unhappy about this; that is, it needs to be kept
up to date, expanded, etc.—Perhaps if ^ can ever find a half way decent teaching
job in the next year or so, I111 really push ahead on this important project.
Nothing was ever done about the research manual mentioned in 195>lu
Ludwig (sp.?) was to go ahead with this and, as you may recall, left broadcasting
for a better paying job.
What is the situation on Prof. Tannenbaum? Has he joined our committee?
I did not see his name on one of the flyers you sent out to us a couple of
weeks ago.
By the way, although Paulu and Harry S. never mentioned a date as to when
Keith was to finish editing the Columbus material, I*m just wondering that if
it is to be of any help if it shouldn*t be wound up by early spring.
There* s nothing else at the moment. I did send rry grants-in-aid report back
to Ken, However, —the day after it arrived.
Cordially,
Raymond D. Cheydleur
Assistant Director
